trailingComments.value:
*
 * A class for making html5 audio elements
 *   targets inside an Arva application, containing a renderable audio
 *   fragment. Like an HTML div, it can accept internal markup,
 *   properties, classes, and handle events.
 *
 * @class AudioSurface
 * @constructor
 *
 * @param {Object} [options] default option overrides
 * @param {Array.Number} [options.size] [width, height] in pixels
 * @param {Array.string} [options.classes] CSS classes to set on target div
 * @param {Array} [options.properties] string dictionary of CSS properties to set on target div
 * @param {Array} [options.attributes] string dictionary of HTML attributes to set on target div
 * @param {string} [options.content] inner (HTML) content of surface

*
     * Start emitting audio frames to subscribers of this surface
this is because it's not been standardised accross browsers yet.

leadingComments.value: this is because it's not been standardised accross browsers yet.

trailingComments.value: this is where we hook up the <audio> element

leadingComments.value: this is where we hook up the <audio> element

trailingComments.value: This just means we will have 128 "bins" (always half the analyzer.fftsize value), each containing a number between 0 and 255.

leadingComments.value: This just means we will have 128 "bins" (always half the analyzer.fftsize value), each containing a number between 0 and 255.

*
     * Start emitting audio frames to subscribers of this surface

trailingComments.value:
*
     * Stop emitting audio frames to subscribers of this surface

     * Stop emitting audio frames to subscribers of this surface

trailingComments.value:
*
     * Emit audio frames to subscribers of this surface
     * @private

leadingComments.value: get the volume from the first 80 bins, else it gets too loud with treble

*
 * A class for making html5 audio elements
 *   targets inside an Arva application, containing a renderable audio
 *   fragment. Like an HTML div, it can accept internal markup,
 *   properties, classes, and handle events.
 *
 * @class AudioSurface
 * @constructor
 *

 * @param {Array.Number} [options.size] [width, height] in pixels
 * @param {Array.string} [options.classes] CSS classes to set on target div
 * @param {Array} [options.properties] string dictionary of CSS properties to set on target div
 * @param {Array} [options.attributes] string dictionary of HTML attributes to set on target div
 * @param {string} [options.content] inner (HTML) content of surface

*
     * Start emitting audio frames to subscribers of this surface
this is because it's not been standardised accross browsers yet.
this is where we hook up the <audio> element
This just means we will have 128 "bins" (always half the analyzer.fftsize value), each containing a number between 0 and 255.

*
     * Stop emitting audio frames to subscribers of this surface

*
     * Emit audio frames to subscribers of this surface
     * @private
get the volume from the first 80 bins, else it gets too loud with treble
